# Iconography

SVG symbols combine the simplicity of icon fonts (copy and paste snippets to show the icons) with the power of inline SVG (edit colors, stroke values, etc.). [Learn how to use SVG symbols](https://blog.nucleoapp.com/the-guide-to-integrating-and-styling-icon-systems-svg-sprites-svg-symbols-and-icon-fonts-da7c424dac1b#91b1)

Since the Iconography is organized as a Nucleo project, you can copy the SVG code directly from the Nucleo app. [More info](https://nucleoapp.com/docs/organizing-icons#why-projects)




export function myFunction(value) {
  console.log('hi there');
  var copyText = `<atlas-icon [icon]="${value}" [color]="color" [size]="size"></atlas-icon>`;
  navigator.clipboard.writeText(copyText);
  var tooltip = document.getElementById(`tooltip-${value}`);
  var stringText = copyText.toString();
  tooltip.innerHTML = `copied to clipboard!!`;
}

export function outFunc() {
  var tooltip = document.getElementById("myTooltip");
  tooltip.innerHTML = "click to copy";
}


## Custom Icon Configuration

Foundation offers various connections to icons. We believe in allowing the product to drive it's iconography. Here's the process in which you should decide how to design your application:

<atlas-icon icon="icon-cloud-upload-24" color="text-base"></atlas-icon>

![Icon Decision](./atlas-docs/icon_decision.png)

### SVG Symbols

SVG symbols combine the simplicity of icon fonts (copy and paste snippets to show the icons) with the power of inline SVG (edit colors, stroke values, etc.). 

How to use SVG symbols:
https://blog.nucleoapp.com/the-guide-to-integrating-and-styling-icon-systems-svg-sprites-svg-symbols-and-icon-fonts-da7c424dac1b#91b1

If you have organized your icons in a Nucleo project, you can copy the SVG code directly from the Nucleo app. More info:
https://nucleoapp.com/docs/organizing-icons#why-projects
